bug.short_desc: [ru_RU] Translation of policycoreutils GUI requires resync with zanata

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Translation of system-config-selinux is rather outdated. I can see some of the strings in zanata master branch have been translated as early as 20/02/2015 and as of now have not been integrated into GUI. Please pull the most up-to-date translation from zanata.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): policycoreutils-2.5.4-fc.24
How reproducible: run system-config-selinux
Actual results: Strings in GUI translated but outdated.
Expected results: Strings in GUI are in sync with zanata.

Same for Brazilian Portuguese
Examples from the application:
select→ boolean → description→ strings 'Dontaudit Apache to search dirs', 'Allow Apache to communicate with sssd service via dbus', 'Allow httpd processes to run IPA helper', Allow users to login using a yubikey OTP server or challenge response mode', etc are in English, but are translated in zanata
https://fedora.zanata.org/iteration/view/selinux/master/languages/pt-BR

secilc-2.5-4.fc24 checkpolicy-2.5-6.fc24 policycoreutils-2.5-12.fc24 libsemanage-2.5-5.fc24 libselinux-2.5-9.fc24 libsepol-2.5-8.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-84d1f77e58

checkpolicy-2.5-6.fc24, libselinux-2.5-9.fc24, libsemanage-2.5-5.fc24, libsepol-2.5-8.fc24, policycoreutils-2.5-12.fc24, secilc-2.5-4.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-84d1f77e58

checkpolicy-2.5-6.fc24, libselinux-2.5-9.fc24, libsemanage-2.5-5.fc24, libsepol-2.5-8.fc24, policycoreutils-2.5-12.fc24, secilc-2.5-4.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
